com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test
Class PatternChecker

java.lang.Object
  com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.PatternChecker

public class PatternChecker
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class to test the SignalDetector.
The class is configured by five public fields (see below expected and following).
When configured, the actual testing is performed by calling run().

Field Summary
 java.lang.String expected
          The DTMF string that we expect to receive.
 java.lang.Boolean[] filtered
          Booleans indicating if the patterns should be filtered.

          The expected value of getPatternIndex().

          The number of DTMFs that we want to receive.

          The various patterns that we want to detect.

Field Detail

expected

public java.lang.String expected
The DTMF string that we expect to receive.
mandatory, no default value

numSignals

public int numSignals
The number of DTMFs that we want to receive.
Passed as is to receiveSignals
Default value is -1

patternStrings

public java.lang.String[] patternStrings
The various patterns that we want to detect.
Each string in the array is set as a value of a PATTERN.
Default is null (no pattern set)

filtered

public java.lang.Boolean[] filtered
Booleans indicating if the patterns should be filtered.
For each of the patternStrings, the corresponding boolean indicates if the SignalDetector.FILTERED_PATTERNS Parameter should be set.
This array must be either null, or at least as large as patternStrings.
Default is null (no pattern filtered).

matchingPatternIndex

public int matchingPatternIndex
The expected value of getPatternIndex().
If set to -1, no checking is performed.
Default to -1.

Constructor Detail

PatternChecker

public PatternChecker(MediaSessionBase msBase,
                      org.apache.log4j.Logger alog)
Method Detail

run

public void run()
         throws java.lang.Exception
Create a LoopbackMediaGroup, and operate on its Player and SignalDetector.
Requires the file designated by the property "testcase.dtmf1-9".
This file must contain inband-modulated DTMFs. The DTMFs are then caught by the SignalDetector of the LoopbackMediaGroup.
Times out after 20 seconds if no DTMF at all is received.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
